_documentation.format: Each class defines its requirements, abilities, and progression
_documentation.requirements: Minimum ability scores required to play this class
_documentation.prime_attributes: Attributes that affect experience point bonuses
_documentation.hit_die: Die type used for hit point calculation
_documentation.base_attack_bonus: How attack bonus progresses with level

classes.name: Fighter
classes.description: Fighters are warriors who have dedicated their lives to the mastery of weapons and armor. They are the backbone of any adventuring party, capable of dealing and absorbing tremendous amounts of damage in combat.
classes.detailed_description: Fighters are specialists in physical combat and warfare. They are trained in the use of all weapons and armor, and can fight effectively with sword and shield, bow, or two-handed weapons. As they gain experience, fighters become increasingly deadly and resilient, able to take on multiple opponents or face down powerful monsters.

special_abilities.name: Weapon Mastery
special_abilities.description: Can use any weapon and armor without penalty

special_abilities.name: Multiple Attacks
special_abilities.description: At higher levels, gains additional attacks against weak opponents

special_abilities.name: Combat Expertise
special_abilities.description: Best attack bonus progression of all classes

classes.starting_equipment: Chain mail, shield, sword, other weapons

classes.name: Magic-User
classes.description: Magic-Users are practitioners of arcane magic, wielding powerful spells that can alter reality itself. Though physically weak, they possess tremendous magical power that grows with experience and study.
classes.detailed_description: Magic-Users spend their lives in study of arcane lore, learning to harness and direct magical energies. They begin weak and vulnerable, but as they advance in level, they gain access to increasingly powerful spells that can devastate enemies, transport the party across great distances, or alter the very fabric of reality.
classes.weapons_allowed: Dagger, staff, dart, oil, torch as weapon

special_abilities.name: Spell Casting
special_abilities.description: Can memorize and cast arcane spells from the Magic-User spell list

special_abilities.name: Spell Research
special_abilities.description: Can research new spells and create magical items at higher levels

special_abilities.name: Read Magic
special_abilities.description: Can read magical writings and scrolls

special_abilities.name: Familiar
special_abilities.description: May gain a magical familiar at higher levels

restrictions: Cannot wear armor (interferes with spell casting)

spell_progression.note: Gains spell slots based on level, limited spells per day
spell_progression.preparation: Must memorize spells from spellbook each day

classes.starting_equipment: Robes, staff, dagger, spellbook, writing materials

classes.name: Cleric
classes.description: Clerics are divine spellcasters who serve a deity or alignment. They combine martial prowess with divine magic, specializing in healing, protection, and turning undead creatures.
classes.detailed_description: Clerics are warriors-priests who serve a particular deity or alignment. They are granted divine magic as a reward for their faith and service. Clerics are especially effective against undead creatures and serve as the primary healers in most adventuring parties. They balance combat ability with divine spellcasting.

special_abilities.name: Divine Spellcasting
special_abilities.description: Can cast divine spells granted by their deity

special_abilities.name: Turn Undead
special_abilities.description: Can turn away or destroy undead creatures through divine power

special_abilities.name: Healing
special_abilities.description: Specializes in healing and protective magic

special_abilities.name: Divine Favor
special_abilities.description: Receives spells directly from their deity through prayer

restrictions: Must serve a specific deity or alignment
May lose powers if they stray from their deity's teachings

spell_progression.note: Gains spell slots based on level, limited spells per day
spell_progression.preparation: Must pray for spells each day

classes.starting_equipment: Chain mail, shield, mace or war hammer, holy symbol

classes.name: Thief
classes.description: Thieves are rogues and scoundrels who excel at stealth, trap detection, and skills that others consider disreputable. They are invaluable for their unique abilities and versatility in dangerous situations.
classes.detailed_description: Thieves are skilled in the arts of stealth, climbing, trap detection and removal, and opening locks. They are not as skilled in combat as fighters, but they can be deadly when attacking from surprise. Many thieves are criminals, but others use their skills in service of adventuring parties or noble causes.
classes.weapons_allowed: Any weapon usable in one hand

special_abilities.name: Thief Skills
special_abilities.description: Climb walls, find and remove traps, pick locks, move silently, hide in shadows, pick pockets, hear noise

special_abilities.name: Backstab
special_abilities.description: Can deliver devastating sneak attacks from behind

special_abilities.name: Read Languages
special_abilities.description: Can attempt to read unknown languages at higher levels

special_abilities.name: Use Magic Items
special_abilities.description: Can use magic items normally restricted to other classes at higher levels

classes.starting_equipment: Leather armor, thieves' tools, dagger, other light weapons
